alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:32PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Whiteside, central Carroll, southeastern Jo Daviess, southwestern Stephenson, north central Scott, Clinton and southeastern Jackson Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 532 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bellevue to DeWitt. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bellevue around 540 PM CDT. Hanover around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Charlotte, Massbach, Clinton, Fulton and Andover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
